text: An IP datagram (let us call this IP datagram - datagram A) cannot reach its destination. An ICMP error message is sent to the source. The data field of the IP datagram that encapsulates the ICMP packet (let us call this second IP datagram - datagram B) contains . (a) only the ICMP header (b) the ICMP header plus 8 bytes of datagram A (c) only datagram A (d) the ICMP header, datagram A’s header, and at least 8 bytes of datagram A’s data field
